For the third Congress in a row I’ve introduced the Agency Accountability Act to address the issue. It would direct unappropriated funds back into the U.S. Treasury thus subjecting them to the normal appropriations process and it would restore congressional oversight.

“Backdoor spending” in federal agencies has become a serious problem over the years. Agencies have the authority to collect funds separate from the amounts approved by the appropriations process but this authority is abused by some agencies to ignore directives from Congress.
